channel.title: What does restarting the server do?
channel.description: hey guys, what is the point of an auto restart thing for a server? i've always wondered what it's supposed to do

item.title: What does restarting the server do?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“mrpopyman, post:8, topic:400798”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=497854.msg3640816#msg3640816 date=1308987134]

The point of turning it on? That isn’t a logical question, mate. The point of turning it on is so other members can log onto the server if portfowarded. Otherwise, it’s quite pointless when turning it on without or if others can’t log into it, unless your programming.

This: (Half Way)

Restarting a server clears all the memory of the server. Any tasks or malfunctions disappear, thus making it work better. Since people create crappy java codes that cause memory leaks and other malfunctions (then people use them), commonly used rs2 servers require quite a bit of restarting.

no im just asking why it would be a good idea for me to turn it on

Well, if you want to run a server mate, you have to turn it on.
[/quote]

no, i mean the auto restarter - why would it be a good idea for me to turn the restarter on?[/quote]

Coelho:

Restarting a server clears all the memory of the server. Any tasks or malfunctions disappear, thus making it work better. Since people create crappy java codes that cause memory leaks and other malfunctions (then people use them), commonly used rs2 servers require quite a bit of restarting.

Read full topic
item.source: What does restarting the server do?
